We need a thread to discuss QoL=/=buff, the terms are not interchangeable, it's one or the other.

This is a QOL buff. A buff is merely 'An effect that makes a gaming character stronger,' this is a buff since it improves his clarity and gameplay allowing players to know better when they should re engage etc. So it improves QOL and it also improves decision making thus making it a buff.
A good example of this is the wraith camp.

I'm surprised there hasn't been an update to standardize effects like these. Giving {{champion:72}} an indicator would help him out just by putting him up to par with every other champion who has a per-target cooldown, and there are lots of other QoL changes, like visual indicators on tethers and range-dependent activations, that are implemented on some champions but not others. Updating these wouldn't even be buffing/nerfing the affected champions so much as adding clarity, and it doesn't seem as difficult as a lot of other changes that recently went through (the bug fix on {{champion:29}} 's ult against inhibitors, for example), so standardizing these effects sounds like a free win.

I have to say that would be totally unnecessary. You should be spamming Q regardless of the stun since it does so much damage. The slow on his E is what needs buffed. Either increase the slow or the duration.

I made a thread a while ago about the same thing (can be seen [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/tsjud1tI-a-slight-qol-buff-for-skarner) for red poster reference) and I believe skarner is in great need of it. I mean it's practically become a standard to have  these kinds of indicators for champions with similar cooldowns. Riot pls pay attention to this, it's completely unfair to our favorite crystal scorpion pokemon to not have this kind of indicator when others do.
